Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: capecoddmb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in March for 2 nights for a quick trip to the City. Great location. Had tickets to a play and it was a 10 min walk. Yes the hotel rooms are VERY small but also very CLEAN and new and had what you needed. There were 6 rooms per floor and we did not have any trouble with waiting for elevators. I really have only good things to say. I travel for a living and go overseas on average of 5 times a month. The room was not that much smaller than the room I have in London. It is just a room for sleeping in and I have to say the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was your typical express. I would stay here again as the location was great and the price was really good for NYC. The bigger chains were more than double (with no breakfast). I am a club member and really have good luck with Holiday Inn Express as a whole. If you are looking for clean, good location and a parking discount at a garage don't look any further. This really works.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....great price”
Reviews.Author: hcwindsor
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The staff were great. Very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and breakfast was super. You are right near TIMES SQUARE. Walking distance to everything. The only thing was that the room was small but we were not there to spend our time in the room. Everything was great....would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid price , safe, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vancouvermomX4
Reviews.Content: Ok just got back from 6 days in this hotel. Yes the rooms are small but they are clean and well furnished. Same with the bathroom. We were 4 family members who spent 6 days with out any problems. The staff was accommodating and pleasant. Requests for more towels of forgotten toiletries were met efficiently. The breakfast had a variety of foods and was perfect for a bite before you started your day. The location was Perfect. I walked home at night from the theaters with my 3 girls and felt very safe. Shopping, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music hall all were a few blocks away. Its a pleasant walk up 5th to many sights. There is a variety shop called Jacks just a few doors away, Perfect for any forgotten items or bottled water for the room. Only reason I did not give 5 circles was I would have likes a mini frig in the room for the drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug bites on my arm, showed the staff”
Reviews.Author: coachs641
Reviews.Content: I am actually a priority club member with 20,000 points. I stayed at the hotel in February and woke up with bed bug bites. The Tim Young the GM said he had a company come in to check for bed bugs but wouldnt give me the name of the company or show a report. I actually showed the bites on my arm and the rude front desk clerk barely lifted her face. They had construction going on and the rooms were tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Thing to Say”
Reviews.Author: Stooge01
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my son and his friend for her birthday. From the minute they arrived, the people there could not have been nicer. Nothing seemed out of the way for them form dropping off thier luggage and checking in early to checking out late and beign able to leave their bags at there while they finish their trip. Everyone was very friendly and seemd to go the extra mile to make my son's stay the best.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good with a couple of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: RJMLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. The good things about the hotel were: - Good central location in Midtown - Cheap ($160 per night) - Free wifi - Free breakfast that tasted OK - Room clean and comfortable - Good shower The bad things about the hotel were: - Room was small. Somewhere to sleep and shower, but nothing more. - Often noisy inside the hotel. The walls are very thin and so noise travels into your room. In particular there is an ice making machine in the corridor outside the lifts that whirs away night and day. - Often noisy outside the hotel. There is a loud bar opposite that plays music relatively late. And there is some kind of car valet business that rings an infuriating bell that sounds like a burglar alarm every time they move a car downstairs. This goes off at intervals all day and was very irritating. My friend who is a New Yorker tells me I should have asked for a room higher up the building (I was on 5th floor) to avoid the outdoor noise. Maybe that is a good tip for next time. - Wifi painfully slow, almost like a pre-broadband dial up speed. OK for checking emails but don't expect more of it. - Lots of repair work to the breakfast area was going on that didn't seem to be getting completed in a hurry. In summary, this is a good tourist hotel if you want to see Manhattan for a few days, and I would stay again for that purpose. It would not be my first choice for another business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but to many noisy people staying there”
Reviews.Author: golflover26
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at this hotel. The best thing about it is the location. The only complaint we have is that we (my wife and me) were sent to Room 702, 7th floor, and the rest of the rooms were occupied by young dutch people which were extremely noisy. They spent the whole night running from one room to the other, talking loud, slamming doors, etc. We called the front desk and they remained silent for a while but as soon as security took off, they went back to the same behavior. This nightmare could have been prevented by sending us to stay at another floor but the staff did nothing. Be aware that being so close to Times Square means that people will be staying there til late at night and when they return to their rooms, they'll wake you up since you can literally hear anything that goes on in your floor, at least that's the case on the 7th where we were staying.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4 great nights in new york”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetravelling51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location. We were there around the 7th Feb and yes there was a little bit of construction going on but not enough to make me think about not going there. This is a fine hotel, clean and we thought the employees were friendly and considerate. The breakfast is also ok. You cant expect the hilton when you only pay medium prices. I would be quite happy staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Zone!”
Reviews.Author: emc59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night (thankfully!) on our trip to NYC this past February. When we arrived, we weren't sure if we were in the right place because there was scaffolding all around the front entry and the lobby was under construction. It would've been nice to have been notified that the hotel is under construction because we probably would've avoided it. I couldn't believe when the staff member told us our room was on the lower level (AKA...the basement!!). I thought...this has to be a joke! We went down one floor to what we ended up referring to as "the dungeon". There are 3 rooms down there, and it is ICE cold! The rooms are teeny, which we didn't really care about, but the window was looking out to the ground level which meant anyone could go back there and look through our window! I happened to look at the fire escape directions...which are completely inaccurate and don't make sense. When I mentioned this to the staff member they said that in order to get to the stairs in case of a fire, we had to go through a door marked "staff only". The only good part of our stay was the location (2 blocks from times square!), and the continental breakfast was really great! If we ever went back, I would have to request a room NOT in the basement!!

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Unimpressed, even for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Jeddicus
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC for my partner's 21st birthday, finding the hotel to be in a good location, only a couple of blocks (lengthways) from Times Sq. and Broadway (plus Subway access), with a decent deli down the street and a range of dining and drinking options very close by: Everything from italian and spanish restaurants to classic Irish pubs to adequate takeaways, all within 2 minutes walking distance. The room was basic, and quite small, but comfortable, with easily operatable heating and air-con (however it was hard to avoid making it too hot or too cold without a bit of fiddling around). The showerroom facilities were fair, with the usual amenities of soap and shower gel, as was the tea and filter coffee tray, and the tv. Outside of the room, however, the hotel failed to maintain its quality. The reception staff were frequently disinterested, and the room safes advertised were not available for any of the full fortnight we were there, despite placement on a waiting list for the key at the beginning of our stay. Unfortunately, they still held by their policy of non-liability for theft of personal belongings not kept in the safe. This would not usually concern me too much, had it not been for the receptionist initially giving me a room key for an occupied room, where I walked in and immediately saw personal belongings and cash on the table. Security in the hotel seems very lax, especially as one guest i got talking to said the same thing had happened when they checked in. The breakfasts were mediocre, in a fairly cramped space, with a small self-service selection of lorne saussage, low quality cheese omlette, various iced buns and pancakes. There was no continental or healthy option apart from a mushy (perhaps canned) fruit salad. After hearing about the referbishments going on in the lobby area, all I can hope is that they are extending the kitchen area to accommodate a better quality of dining experience. However those hopes are fleeting. For the location, I would reccommend this hotel. As long as you intend to eat elsewhere, i would suggest considering it if you could get a reduced price for room-only. However based on the security issues alone I would avoid it entirely, and I reccommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Low-end hotel, but can get good prices for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Gogocar
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Saturday in mid February. The price is good for NYC and it's in a pretty good location if you want to be near Grand Central Station (which we did because we wanted ot get to a number of other places both uptown and in Brooklyn). The rooms are small - but if all you need is a place to sleep they are fine - clean and comfortable. Currently the hotel lobby in under construction so they were providing breakfast at a cafe down the road. For me the breakfast was good - eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, sweet rolls - but for my wife who likes fruit and yoghurt it was barely adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Clean and comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-ss-64
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in January when they had just started construction work in the lobby, must have been hard on them but did not bother us. Because of that work they gave us coupons for breakfast at a nearby Café Manhattan a very nice and interesting place which we will visit again. The room was on a high floor, clean and warm. The staff was friendly and efficient. Due to that and the excellent location we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in very small packages”
Reviews.Author: Steve61Florida
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, but very small. The furnishing were neat, clean, and modern. The breakfast was good, but it was very crowded. The hotel staff did a great job of stocking breakfast food and keeping things moving. Great location - only two blocks to Times Square and a few feet to 5th Avenue. Lots of great restaurants nearby, including Goodburger.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here a lot ... wish the service was better/more caring”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler_724
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of timese because I like the location and if you shop around can find it at good prices. But its just a bed, i.e. place to stay, nothing special. The rooms are small but clean and reasonably well maintained. That's why I stay here along with the location which is convenient but this is a no service hotel. Ask for anything in this hotel and the response is what you want something from us? I am a member of the chain's loyalty club but that gets you nothing at this hotel. Absolutely nothing. Maybe a bottle of water if you ask where's my check in gift from the club. The club is etitled to late check out ... well not at this hotel. The response is always oh we are so busy, maybe we will give you an extra 30 minutes or if you are really lucky 1 hour. Nothing more. You point out the club and their response is like "so?" Almost always when you arrive before 3 pm rooms are never ready yet in the morning the mains start banging around in halls before 8 am and they do anything they can to get you out of the rooms ASAP. The elevators are a disaster in the mornings especially. They have two to serve 25 floors and they take forever to come. If you have an appointment to make make sure you leave 15 minutes for the elevators to get down to street level. Can't comment what the new lobyy will be like but the breakfast area has been tiny in size overstuffed with tables and really hard to get the free breakfast the promise. Sometimes the eggs are like rocks and they always taste (if they taste) like reconsisuted egg substitue. The idea of the breakfast is nice but the space is too small and the food very medicore at best. The price at this hotel also varies wildly. Shop around because this place takes any opportunity it can to jack up the price and if you end up paying $300 you are going to be really disappointed in this place. Generally once they jump the price above about $100 or $150 a night I skip this place and go on to others in the neighborhood. I might pay as much or more but the rooms are bigger and the service more caring at the bigger/better hotels. This place in my opinion is best only when it is a cheep stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NicoleF551
Reviews.Content: Is stayed here 4 nights and although the room was on the smallish side with limited closet space, it was very clean and had a nice updated look. The staff was very nice and accomodating. Breakfast area is small but the food is good. They were in the process of renovation while I was there though so it may be better in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Could Improve...”
Reviews.Author: WassimEh
Reviews.Content: Good and convenient location, a couple of blocks from Times Square and the Subway Station. Repair/Renovation taking place in the main lobby. For those unlucky ones who are put in higher floors, there's always traffic building up on wait for elevators (only two & slow!) Stayed at the M floor (below 1st!) so taking the stairs was not an issue. The real issue was that on the M floor, the office of the housekeeping created a lot of noise where all the workers were meeting, talking (shouting to an extent) and laughing... very annoying early in the mornings. Other than that, the breakfast is temporarily served at the Manhattan Cafe, less than a minute walk on 45th. Overall, the service is good, rooms are clean (but very small).

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Wallydeb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a visit to NYC. It is an easy walk to everything: theatre district - 2 blocks, Central Park - 14 blocks, every subway line, restaurants, clubs, all neighborhoods - it's all easily accessible from here. The hotel itself is not fancy, the rooms are not huge, but it is CLEAN, (NO bedbugs - a huge factor), and all the fixings are relatively new and well maintained. The staff is very cordial, helpful and polite - actually friendly. If you are like me and when visiting NYC, spend every second walking the City, going to shows, museums, shopping, eating, etc., and just want a reasonably priced, safe, comfortable and clean place to crash - this is perfection. Another big plus is that this HIE is pet-friendly. My German Shepherd mutt and I love the walk to and in Central Park and that she is welcomed here. Just a note: right now they are renovating the lobby, so have arranged for breakfast (included in the price of the room), to be served at Cafe Manhattan, just a few doors down the street and this too has been done well - no inconvenience whatsoever. My compliments to the management and staff of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dancas547
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right off 5th ave. Lobby and rooms are small but clean and comfy. Very nice

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JV0628
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel at 2:30 PM for early check in (regular check inn is at 3:00 PM) and Room was not ready until about 4:30 PM. After that dissapointing mishap things were good. Nice room, nothing fancy but clean. Location of hotel was great. Close to everything (Grand Central, Bryant Park and Rockefeller Center).

Reviews.Title: “good midtown location”
Reviews.Author: Beth G
Reviews.Content: this is pretty much 'what it says on the tin'. basic facilities, for a reasonable price in a good central location. no frills, but clean, and a buffet breakfast to start the day. we had a double double, which was pretty close for comfort for three people, but to be expected this centrally. (stayed October 2009)

Reviews.Title: “Nice option if using rewards points”
Reviews.Author: JCC868
Reviews.Content: The hotel was updated and clean but cramped. I suppose that is a bit normal for that area of Manhattan, though. The proximity to attractions is really nice as well. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I didn't get offered an upgrade for being a platinum Priority club memebr member, however. Overall, I'd stay again on rewards points. It would be very hard to pay $500 for a room less than 100 sq ft.

Reviews.Title: “so disappointed so far”
Reviews.Author: ddana_11
Reviews.Content: The front desk didn't mention anything about the parking being blocks away and advise we leave our stuff before we park. We had to hull all of our luggage from the parking deck to the hotel. It was not fun. Then when we checked into the room there was not a mini fridge.The fridge they brought looked like to belonged in a working garage. IT was all beat up and huge. And because it was so big they had to take the chair out of the room to make it fit. The room is so small it doesn't even have a closet. I feel so cramped. Not looking forward to the next 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- good rooms”
Reviews.Author: andyr1023
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very small rooms -- but that is normal for NYC. Our room was very adequate and included a 32" LCD TV and a coffee maker. The room was clean and quiet and we both got a good night's sleep. They have a free breakfast which is very good -- the usual Holiday Inn Express fare. The location is excellent -- about a 7-10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The staff is friendly and helpful. They have a business center with a printer -- handy for printing a boarding pass. Since our flight was not leaving until 6:30 PM, we were able to store our luggage after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: CrispyRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in February 2011. The location was awesome mainly due to the price and location. Pros: 1. I got a Friend and Family discount (but the original price was already very appropriate for the location and I would've stayed here either way) 2. Location - Very centrally located in terms of subway stations, right in between Times Square and Grand Central Terminal, very convenient. Close to 5th Ave for buses as well (and a Chipotle couple doors down!) 3. Free Breakfast! I am always impressed with free continental breakfasts that has more than donuts, toast, OJ, and coffee. It was a pretty good variety, there were days with biscuit and gravy, omelettes, sausages. I mean it wasn't an excellent breakfast, but I appreciated starting my day with some food in my tummy! Overall, I had a great experience, the staff was friendly (not too friendly were it just felt pretentious, but friendly enough that I didn't feel neglected!). They addressed any needs and concerns that we had, informative staff. In terms of the room, yes they are small, but it's NYC! What did you expect? Only complaint I have is that housekeeping was a bit noisy in the morning, but I think it's because my room was located next to a closet or something. And that's why I sleep with ear plugs, then it's no problem at all!

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LakeHighlandsMom
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, and the sink area has no place to put toiletries, but it was clean and the beds were comfortably firm. Service was outstanding. Each request (towels, kleenex, etc.) was responded to with lightening speed. The breakfast was decent and the location couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: rjrobbin
Reviews.Content: business trip. Not my first choice. However, in December, the hotels are busy. This place is just two block from Times Square and three blocks to the other direction to Grand Central. So the location isn't bad. The room is not the largest. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was clean. The breakfast was good...several hot items. The interesting thing (never seen this before), they have this machine that produces pancakes...you push the button, and in a few minutes two perfect pancakes come out. I am sorry...but I just can't justify $399 for a room. I know if it weren't for business, I wouldn't have paid that much. I questioned if I had gotten the corporate rate...Front desk person said normal rate was $499. ouch.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ssvlaunch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this small but comfortable hotel for two days. The room was tiny! It had everything we needed though and was clean, bed was fine. The location was about as good as it gets. Walked everywhere, Rock Center, Central Park, Broadway even a bit further to the Wall Street area. Beware parking is offsite and a little bit of a hassle but if you can come in on the train it's also right there. The staff were also perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - little room !”
Reviews.Author: Jaja27
Reviews.Content: Good point is central location, you reach the Rockfeller Center and Times Square within a few minutes walk. Family room definitively too small for 2 adults and 2 teenagers and 4 big suitcases.... but we managed to each have a little space. Breakfast nothing special but at least you do not go out with an empty tummy. As the hall is crowded in the mornings you sometimes have to wait to have a seat ! Overall ok for the price, just be aware of lack of space ! Ok for 3-4 nights, we stayed 8 ! Positive point is good service at the reception, they answer well at all your questions (map of the town etc..)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Bill-Beany
Reviews.Content: November weekend getaway for my wife and I. I walked from Penn Central Station, 11 blocks to Hotel. Walked to Grand Central Station to pick my wife up after transfer from LaGuardia. Walked to The Rock, Central Park,MOMA and a block and a half to Times Square. Walked or took subway all weekend, not one taxi! Hotel is in a great location and a great value for Midtown Manhattan. You could pay double for 50-80 more square feet but all we did was sleep and shower there. King bed was better than average and bathroom was great, marble floor.Staff was friendly and excellent on directions and recommendations... Can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOMS BUT CLEAN AND GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: donjaime24
Reviews.Content: It´s a small hotel, small lobby, small rooms, but everything works perfect. Great crew, all my shops in the internet were delivered correctly and without an extra charge, and when you travel to work, all you need is a comfortably bed, good service and a good bathroom...and it has all of that. No problemas to leave your stuff and ask for it everytime you need after check out, and for breakfast, it has all you need. A littel bit expensive, but it works great, because it is not crowded, even if it is full!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable central city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil P
Reviews.Content: Yes it's a small hotel, only a hand full of rooms per floor, yes rooms look over offices... BUT it's in the middle of NY. 5 mins walk one way to Rockaflla Plasa, 5 mins the other to Times Square. The breakfast area/lobby is small, and the food didn't look appertising (but then I'm a Brit and grits & scones for breaky isn't apertising), but there's 2 deli's across the street to the hotel, and lots of eating places within minutes. I've only given it 4 stars because of price, but then book early and you may get a better rate. We were offered a suit upgrade at no extra charge because we wanted a roll-out bed and normal rooms are too small for roll-outs. The suit room is a good size, 1 TV in each room and plenty of tv channels to choose from (over 200), the room was clean, staff were pleasant. No compaints.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location in Town”
Reviews.Author: LicaBT
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in Manhattan, almost in the middle of the fifth avenue, close to Rockefeller Center, San Patrick Church, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, Broadway, the Grand Central Station.......It is close to everything. The streets around the hotel are safe at night, it is possible to walk to Broadway, to Radio City and all Middletown. The rooms are small but very clean. The breakfast was simple, but could be better. The staff was helpful, me and my husband didn't have any problem there. I recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, Small”
Reviews.Author: Travel4fun9
Reviews.Content: Came here for a brief vacation to show the sights to our teenage boys. The hotel was well located and the price competitive for NY but the room was small. Service was good, room was clean and in the end we were just staying there not buying it so for a few days it was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “little too cozy”
Reviews.Author: soxkitty
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel and never thought I could have such a small room, had a mini fridge in the room- which was put under the desk and so really no room to walk or sit- in order to move in the room- only one person coiuld be up at a time- the carpet in the hallways needs care badly- shampoo it or replace it,sitting on the double bed and facing the other bed- knees would bump into the next bed- wow! the staff was nice- and helpful- the view out the window was of the back and garbagy area of another building

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a great location”
Reviews.Author: dreemscometrue
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in and pretty good breakfast choices. i.e. cereal, yougurt, pancakes, sausage, bacon, boiled eggs, omelets, scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, pastries, bananas, milk and juices. Room was small but adequate and very clean. We purchased the pizza delivery package and had a large 2 topping free pizza and 1 liter bottle of soda delivered to the room 4 out of our 5 days. No bathtub but nice walk-in shower. Comfortable beds, 6 rooms per floor, hotel was sold out and we had very minimal wait for the elevator. I've stayed in nyc about 6 other times and would definitely choose this hotel again. The only negative I can think of is the amount of space and tables in the breakfast area. Very tight squeeze between tables and around chairs. Staff was very helpful and our room looked out over 45th st. Hotel is just around the corner from 5th ave. Computer use on the lower level was an added bonus. There were 2 computers both with printing capability to print out vouchers, directions etc. My husband and I were both pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms in depressing neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: It was okay, but I wouldn't go out of my way to ever stay here again. There is a thin, thin, thin space between the beds and the furniture-- to the point of it being comical. A few rooms might have nice views-- ours looked right into the building across the street. This is sort of a weird part of midtown-- one that has a bit of a depressing vibe-- the address may sound like it's in the thick of things, but it's not. There's a tiny lobby where you can have processed breakfast. I slept okay here. Beds were okay. Just felt kind of isolated and lonely.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Victor C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and it was not a very pleasant experience. The hotel is really very small. The rooms are very tight, we can not even open the bags at the same time. It has only a very small closet and some drawers. In our room, the air conditioning was broken and the mattress made noises. There are 6 rooms per floor and 20 floors. But has only two elevators, including the use of service and housekeeping. Lingered about 10 minutes waiting to be able to go up to the ninth floor. In one of these waiting times, we saw that one of them was stuck in 4th floor, so we stopped to see why, and it was full of rubbish from rooms that were being arranged. Nevertheless, the rooms were clean, and I believe that the corridor as well, since beginning to vacuuming the hall at 8:00 am. The view from our room was to the side of an office building, where people were working at their desks looking very close to our hotel. About Breakfast , it was ok, even had enough food options. But the breakfast area was very small, and there are very few places to sit, then was crowded and almost impossible to eat. We paid 280.00 usd per day, and request only a late check out, and they did not allow us. The location is great, but not worth. We will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ReenaRani
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute for business. Very expensive at $490 and an unclean room. When I removed the bed covers, I discovered both a moquito and a spider. A fly buzzed around the room all night. I was in a room on the first floor, next to the elevators. The curtains could not be drawn so a harsh light came through the window the entire night. Asked for a wake-up call at 5am but it never came. TV remote did not work. Decent complimentary continental breakfast. Central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Nelak
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints!! Room was clean and quiet!! Complimentary breakfast was very nice. Would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfy room. Front desk staff very polite and helpful. Great breakfast buffet in the morning. Great location, easy walk to theaters. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BLOOD STAINED SHEETS AND TERRIBLE BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: annie b
Reviews.Content: Iv Stayed In NYC Several Times the only good thing about this hotel is location.first off the bed my comforter was stayed with blood unfortunatley I discovered it next morning. the pillows were flat the mattress itself makes a loud creaky sound . I only stayed one night my hole body hurt from the crappy MATtRESS. now breakfast , they have these pre made ommlets were so gross in the center of them they pile on some colorfull mushy stuff EWW.. The pancakes taste like sponges, If you want to stay at a great hotel stay at staybridge i PAYED $147 A NIGHT AND YOU GET A SUITE WITH A KITCHEN AND THE BREAKFAST THERE IS YUMMY

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: happy_snapper_11
Reviews.Content: We just spent 7 nights in this hotel, King size bed, very comfortable,air conditioning worked well, FREE breakfast was excellent and if you couldn't find something to eat for breakfast, it would have been your fault. The staff were excellent, the rooms were clean and the location was excellent within easy walking to Times Square, subway and busses. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit New York City. They also have free internet available which is excellent when one is away from home for so long

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet”
Reviews.Author: agm11
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but as others have said, you only sleep there. The location is great. Theatre district is very close, the excitement of 5th and 6th avenue is truly a 5 minute walk. Our daughter very much enjoyed getting her picture with the Naked Cowboy. Although you are in a city of millions, the only noise we heard was an ambulance going by the building with the siren. Breakfast is fine, I would suggest getting there early as seating is limited. The staff was great, we were able to leave our packs there after checking out so we could travel around. Picked them up at 3 and we were on our way back home. Overall a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard Q
Reviews.Content: We were at the Holiday Inn Express New York City Fifth Ave. hotel on August the 4th, 2011 and found the hotel to be well situated since we were going to Radio City Music Hall to see Zarkana. It is at 8 min. walking distance to the hotel. I had Booked with hotels.com and they confirmed me a two double bed room and when we got there they told us that is was rented so they gave us a Kingsized Bed room. This was our only disapointment since it was a father son trip. We had friendly service at the desk. The breakfast the next day was appreciated especially the Cinnamon Rolls, which were warm and tasty. The hotel is clean and the bathroom has a nice shower. There was no noise to keep us awake. It is close to Fifth Ave. and Time Square. Good restaurants that are close. We got there early and they took our luggage even if the room wasn't ready. Ask for discount for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: lorijeannj
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) stayed here Aug. 4 - 7, 2011. Room was clean, small, but again clean. King bed was comfy. (I am not sure how much space there would be with two doubles.) We had 2nd floor room (not much of a view) and I am glad we did. Elevator was slow at times so we would use stairs. Front desk was fine and friendly. Maid service - exceptional. Free breakfast was o.k., only went down once but it was a great way to start off the day. Coffee - always available and free, 24 / 7. Had pizza from across the street one night to get my NYC pizza fill and it was great. Also sold six packs and bottles of wine. Two blocks to Times Square and all the subways you need. We did not have car and can't give info on parking. We took Amtrak into city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sergio303631
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the breakfast helpful. The free Internet is a nice plus. I just wish the service was a little better. The front desk attendants were not friendly enough. The best part is the location, so close to Times Square. I do reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enough for One Night”
Reviews.Author: ShoestringGuru
Reviews.Content: Since I'm not lucky enough to live in the Manhattan and avoid the subway and bus late at night, it's a nice treat to live it up once in a while and meander back to a hotel room. After a great night watching Zarkana and walking around Rockefeller, it didn't matter that my own bedroom in Queens is twice the size of this hotel room...what mattered was that it was clean and the breakfast was hearty. I may call myself ShoeStringGuru, but I do like these little luxuries once in awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel! Brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas095
Reviews.Content: If you intend on doing what we did whilst in New York, which is seeing as many popular landmarks as possible then this hotel is absolutely perfect for you! We went in February 2011, there was 4 of us. 2 doubles beds and a great bathroom was great! It was a bit cramped, but what do you really need to do in there? Sleep, get dressed, and maybe relax in the evening then the space issue, wasn't an issue at all! We had plenty of room to get dressed, make ourselves at home, store our things and relax and eat! The room was clean when we arrived, and cleaned throughout the week meaning the bathroom was always nice and clean and clean towels were provided when we needed them. The breakfast was great! Jetlag meant we were in the breakfast area at about 6am when it opened! But even when we went down later there was somewhere to sit and plenty of food. The breakfast was basic, but substantial! Everyday there were differences. A mixture of warm food (American sausages, omelettes etc) and then cakes and pastries, and also cereals and milk filled us up adequately! There was always a member of staff on hand to clear up and always receptionists at the desk to talk to. The computers were useful, for online booking and tea and coffee making in the reception with takeaway cups were great to warm you up on the walk out into the snow! In terms of the location, this place was fantastic! Literally, five minutes walk from Times Square & Central Park. Literally, 2 minutes from The Empire State & Rockefeller Centre! Not a very long taxi journey down to Wall Street, Ground Zero & the ferry port for Liberty & Ellis Island. And in terms of shops and other attractions it was honestly really close. There were restaurants literally nextdoor and opposite the hotel, meaning it was easy to eat out somewhere close, or somewhere to get takeaway and take back to your room. The Chinese Buffet nextdoor was great, and the Pizza we took away from the place opposite was amazing! ;) Overall, a great hotel with competitive, but reasonable rates that can provide everything you need for a busy stay in New York! In terms of location, this must be one of the best yet reasonable places to stay! PS, "swimming pool" is marked as 'not sure' because there wasn't one! And "kids activities" is a '3' because there isn't loads to do for the, but do they really need it?

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: lilo33
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with only 6 suites per floor. Not surprisingly, the entrance, lobby and breakfast area is very tight. The room was small, with no closet, but a small armoir instead. Despite the small size, the room was clean and comfortable. I was surprised to learn that there are no room safes (although they do offer to lock your valuables away at the front desk). The front staff were genial and helpful. Their business centreconsists of 2 computers and 2 printers on a lower level, in a small hallway in front of the elevators, next to a vending machine. There was never a wait to use them. (Yay!) The breakfast, though not gourmet, was plentiful consisting of cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, danish, english muffins, breads, hard boiled eggs and pastries. Hot items rotated between "scrambled" eggs, an omlette-type thing with process cheese sanwiched inside, sausage patties, the thinnest bacon imaginable and sausage gravy. There was also a "pancake machine"...but I did not get a chance to try it. The location is off the high traffic areas, but a short walk (2-3 blocks) from Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station and Rockefeller Center. I made this trip with my mother who is in her 70's. She liked the place so much, she's making plans for a return trip in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DDDFJD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located near Times Square, 5th Avenue & Central Park. Our room was beautiful & extremely comfortable. The bathroom, though small, looked brand new! The king bed was very nice. Madeline, at the front desk, was sweet, helpful & gave perfect directions. The breakfast, which is included, was delightful, though the area where it is served is a bit cramped. We loved it & would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small But Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: krosie89
Reviews.Content: We were forced into this hotel after our Travel Agent lost our reservation at another hotel, the night before we left to New York. We managed to get the last room in this hotel, albeit more money then our previous one. This hotel was in a great spot, close to shopping and Times Square. The rooms were small but you're not going to NYC to stay in your room anyway. Beds were comfy and room was quit. The free breakfasts were good and a great way to start all our days in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, loved everything about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blackieMobile
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful experience! Room size with a king bed was perfect for a couple. We have stayed in rooms smaller in hotels in the French Quarter of New Orleans. Room was super clean, bed was comfortable, air conditioner was superb! We were on 2nd floor, two doors from elevator never heard any noise! Nice breakfast, wonderful cinnamon roles, aal day coffee! Can not beat the price, the friendly staff and the fantastic location!!!! We will be back! Anonymous from Alabama

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bill1961mo
Reviews.Content: Two blocks to Times Square and to Grand Central. Great breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff. Short cab and subway or long walk to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: CurleyDog
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, W. 45th was closed due to a parade, so my husband circled the block while we tried to get an early check in. There were no rooms available, however the front desk requested we store our bags and park in the garage on 46th for $35 per night. We explored the empire state building, times square, rockefeller center, and central park by foot. When we returned, the front desk remembered us and checked us in to 2204. We had 2 small full-size beds with not much more room to walk. The 4 of us squeezed in and unpacked. The room reminded me of a cabin in a cruiseship, everything was in its place and was clean and maintained, just what I expect in NYC. We had local pizza/soda in our room package that was delicious and the complimentary breakfast was what you expected but with unexpected yummy cinnamon rolls. The HI Express' value was worth the money and I would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nancyk4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in June, 2011. Great location, couple of blocks to Broadway, couple of blocks to Rockefeller Center, 1 block to 5th Ave. I was surprised about how compact Manhattan is and many attractions are within walking distance. The room on the 21st floor was nice, small but clean and very quiet. I did get ice one night and got a glob of mold with the ice. The breakfast was okay--cereal, rubbery eggs, juice, coffee, milk, rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: JayInAZ
Reviews.Content: great deal in NYC. clean rooms & lobby, nice staff, rooms seemed brand new. rooms are small, but that's typical in NYC. got a great price, so wasn't complaining. only area of improvement was the bed - not very soft, and the pillows were like bags of cotton balls from the pharmacy - no support whatsoever. Would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and the friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: ScottandJo_11
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New York and we were greeted by very friendly staff after a 23 hour flight - we were in walking distance to Times Square and Starbucks Coffee which was perfect! The restaurants on either side were awesome and the little park a few doors down was a great place to sit under the trees for some relaxation in the city. The complimentary breakfast was great and such a variety for us all. We were always greeted with a wam smile and the cleanliness was fantastic! The rooms were small but we were expecting smaller - it had everything we needed and the beds were heaven! Very clean, very quiet and we'll be back one day...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: ShereeRobinette
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing. Came to see SNL season finale and location ws perfect. That said, the staff was not at all friendly or helpful, even to their premium members. I was surprised at their rudeness even for New York City standards. Rooms ok and clean. Breakfast average for HIE but breakfast room so crowded that you cannot leave your table until another guests leaves or moves. Stayed in Holiday Inn Express Times Square two months prior and the manager there, Hunter Glass, was awesome. He and his staff went out of their way to provide information, directions, etc. He left the breakfast ar open until guests quit arriving and the rooms was open. This new hotel was sparkling clean. Next trip back to Times Square Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.Very good service.”
Reviews.Author: WensleydaleinSurrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to New York as a belated birthday trip.The hotel was lovely and clean, we had superb service and the free breakfast was an added bonus!! (although it was a bit repetative- more choice needed) Set in an ideal location for all of the attractions what more could you wish for.We were on the 7th floor and never had to wait long for the elevator.No traffic noise at all. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: DebbiesOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Yes, tiny. There is a closet, but it's only about as wide as a single hanger. It blocks the view of the TV if you're seated at the desk. I'd call the room I had even small by NYC standards. Everything looked clean enough, except for the carpet. Worst, the carpet was actually sticky near the desk. The location is off Times Square, but only by a few blocks and it's a very easy walk. There are restaurants on the same block, so if you just want to grab a bit you have a selection very close by. This hotel was far from inexpensive, but was one of the least expensive that was still walking distance from my destination.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: goRedSox1
Reviews.Content: My husband, two year old daughter, and I recently spent two nights at this hotel. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms were very clean and comfortable,a bit on the small side but we made due even with a toddler to share the space with. The front desk staff was very helpful, even getting us cartons of milk in the middle of the night when our little one decided she couldn't sleep. Having breakfast included was a huge plus for us. We were able to get a table easily both mornings and all enjoyed a great, filling, breakfast. We booked using our Priority Club points, so I can't comment on the value for the rental fee - I have no idea now much this room would have cost had we paid cash. That being said, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and faciltiy; been here twice; will look to stay again!"”
Reviews.Author: kjchj
Reviews.Content: Such a convenient location; rooms very clean; nice meal. Can't beat it! Only problem is there are two elevators for nearly 20 floors; a very slow system;

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru007_11
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and well-equipped with everything you need. High speed internet worked great and tons of cable tv channels. Breakfast had tons of options - all for free! And the front desk staff was exceptional - very professional and went above and beyond to provide top notch service. You can't beat the location, price and quality

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sightseeing and shopping”
Reviews.Author: ameeta_roy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weekend of New York sightseeing and couldn't have asked for a better deal. The location is excellent in terms of proximity to tourist spots especially Times Square, Broadway , Empire State Building, Madame Tussauds and the Rock to name a few. All within walking distance from the hotel and this was a boon considering we had very little time and were trying our best to cram in as much as we could over the two and a half days we had. 5th Avenue is also a great place for shopping and eating out, and we had some of the best brands having their outlets with some great deals in places like Saks. In our case, the hotel location made it well worth its value. About the hotel itself, the reception area is quite cramped with arriving and departing guests, their luggage, a small corner serving the famous holiday in express complimentary breakfast and the hotel check in counter, all vying for space. We had a clean functional room with complimentary internet and although small, we were not complaining since we were really just using it for sleeping in the nights and were out pretty much all day. The staff was very courteous and helpful and they even kept our luggage safely for us on the last day when we had checked out in the morning but couldn't drag our bags with us while sightseeing. Overall, a great value for getting to stay in a place that is so close to New York sights and is still very reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas095
Reviews.Content: Where to start really! This really was a great hotel which I would highly recommend. The location is great for the stereotypical NYC Tourist. Five minute walk from Rockefellar, MoMA. Ten minutes from Empire State, Times Square and a short taxi drive down to the World Trade Centre and Liberty & Ellis Island cruises. Not only this there are some great places to eat and get souvenirs seconds from the hotel. The staff were are great. Cleaners always said good morning and did a great job. Receptionists were lovely and were very "in-the-know". The breakfast was pretty basic but brilliant to fill you up. Cereal, small selection of hot things, cakes etc and hot and cold drinks - all great! As far as the room goes it was very small, but clean and everything was in good working order. Good bathroom, great TV & channels, good quality beds and nice view. The free Internet was very useful (especially when wanting to research an attraction etc) and accessible. If you're coming to this hotel expecting them to entertain you, you need to look again. But if you want everything a hotel should provide, good food, accomadation and staff, you've come to the right place :)

Reviews.Title: “See you next time. It was great.”
Reviews.Author: eloise_freeze
Reviews.Content: I took my granddaughter to NYC for Thanksgiving. We stayed in this wonderful hotel and enjoyed every minute. The bed was very comfortable, room clean, staff was fabulous. My granddaughter loved to go to the lobby and get hot chocolate or tea when we came home from wherever we were. Location is perfect. Added bonus was a GREAT hot breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Five stays within 12 months...Need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: TKtoo
Reviews.Content: It IS a Holiday Inn Express--not the Plaza. As an experienced HIE stayer, I can say this one is one of the best. Our first trip was December of 2009 and we've elected to come back here for all of them. We tend to visit the city by walking to or around areas and are back in the room around 10 or 11 pm. 1) Location: just blocks from Grand Central Station, Times Square, Bryant Park & Rockefeller Center = subway EASILY accessible (we've only cabbed twice). Lots of little markets and restaraunts for that last bottle of water or snack late at night on the way back in. 1/2 block off of 5th Ave. If you like to walk, most of the major tourist attractions are walkable: Empire State Building, Central Park are about 1-mile, MOMA is about 3/4 mile, the Met is about 1-1/2 and the Guggenheim is about 2. Around the corner on 6th Ave. is really lovely at Christmas. 2) Accomodations: rooms are very cozy (translate small), but some more so than others (we've always stayed in rooms with King beds). Some have tubs, some do not. Always clean and no bed-bug experiences. Coffee maker in-room. Wireless service excellent & consistent. Some rooms don't have full length mirrors. 3) General: pretty decent coffee 24/7 (decaf & regular) plus tea and hot chocolate packets. Breakfast is the typical HIE buffet. Enough to get you through the morning plus free, hot and edible in NYC is a rare thing. Our rooms have always been very quiet--even close to the elevator. However, I admit I would not want the room described by the person who said he was across from the desk (more litterally--down the short hallway). That one would be VERY noisy due to the lobby. I've never seen anyone leaving that room as a guest. Elevators seem slow to me. On the upper levels, I can punch the button, wait, go back to my room for forgotten item then back out and still catch it. There are only five (?) rooms on most floors and fewer on the two or so that have ice-machines. Public computers are VERY public--right in front of the elevators on the lower level (i.e. NO privacy). 4) Service: Staff is generally very good and very friendly. Meeting room requests (extra-towels, etc) has been inconsistent--sometimes they are very quick, sometimes I give up and go down to the desk. Front desk was exceptional the first few trips. They've been at least as good or better than most the last couple of trips. It's a small place, so expect to share the elevators with the service staff. They have always been very, very considerate when doing so. I've recommended this to friends who've stayed and their experiences seem to be similar to ours.

Reviews.Title: “Room small, but water was hot, with good pressure.”
Reviews.Author: mbeth1403
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I had some shopping and travel offices to visit and opted to stay here overnight rather than rush home to Long Island in the evening. Room on 20th floor was small, but quiet and clean. Water was hot and drains worked. (We have stayed at 5-star hotels with worse water pressure, and banging doors.) Location is terrific: we walked around the corner to the Algonquin for evening drinks and a snack. This not a hotel for you if you are opting to save money by cramming four people into a tiny space. Complementary breakfast had hot coffee and delicious, large croissants. Other items as well (yougurt, danish, bananas) but I was not especially hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Good for students and tourists.”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: Small, cramped, overrun with students/backpacks. No lobby to speak of, understaffed at the desk. Room was decent. Will try hard not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wheeler65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this Holiday Inn Express for 7 nights. We loved it. We do not have anything negative to say. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My room was very clean. The bed was comfortable. The free internet is a plus!! The buffet style breakfast is good. I could eat the cinnamon rolls every day! They are great. If you are looking for a good place to stay while in NYC, in my opinion, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments here!”
Reviews.Author: spartan66
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this Holiday Inn. Location is fantastic. We were greeted warmly, allowed early check in and later departure because we are Priority members. Rooms are clean and staff is very responsive. This hotel is BUSY, but front desk staff is always polite and knowledgable. Breakfast is generous. What I don't appreciate from this hotel chain (not this property's fault) is the game playing about room rates. Two months prior to our arrival, rates were $350 a night. We book at another property and keep trying to get into Fifth Ave. Finally, three days before arrival, we are in where we are in at around $200. Big hassles then trying to get out of other property.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: grambudgie
Reviews.Content: I had some trouble with the parking garage across from the Holiday Inn Express. I needed a place to stay, as it was 3 am. The night auditor David was very friendly and helpful, at the same time showing genuine compassion for our situation. The next morning, Natasha, the Front Office MGR gave us a late check out. ( a rarity in NYC on a week night when the hotels are generally filled with business people.) After a very bad experience, the Holiday Inn Express helped ease the pain. Ther was not one employee that did not greet us with a smile. A very refreshing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Run from this place.”
Reviews.Author: kjm1977
Reviews.Content: Live in NJ and work in city. Book often in the city and first try here. Was given room across from desk on first floor. Room had coat check tickets all over window sill. Had to call maintenance for TV clicker who said only one they had and I had to return to front desk in AM. No bathtub. Noise all night so poor sleep day before a Board meeting. Front desk didn't care. Charged me $470 for this bliss. Breakfast was set up in AM which was only saving grace. Not great - but at least they had coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: travel8866
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a girls getaway to the Big Apple for some shopping and Broadway shows...it was perfect...there were 4 girls to one room and we managed great...the room, although on the smaller side, was very clean, with everything we needed...called for extra towels one morning and they were delivered within a few minutes....the buffet breakfast was great...good varaiety and was included in the room price which made an already great deal even better...the location was absolutely perfect...extremely central to all the major sites and shopping areas...the staff were absolutley wonderful...always smiling and so friendly & helpful....would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: calligram
Reviews.Content: We called to book our room at the Holiday Inn Express after we'd had enough of killing cockroaches at our cheaper 'boutique' hotel. When we arrived the next morning and explained the situation (including the fact that our luggage had been missing for three days), Michael at the front desk found us a room right away. The room was excellent - great bed and linens, new bathroom fixtures and amenities, flat-screen TV and tons of channels. There are two computers with free internet in the basement, and a great continental breakfast in the mornings. An absolute winner at a great price, just two blocks from Times Square...we will not hesitate to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Claes71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights using priority club points. Location was great room very small. Breakfast was ordinary. There is an ATM in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn NYC”
Reviews.Author: jsgreen
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was near a lot of the things I wanted to see (Rockefeller Center, Time Square, lots of restaurants). The only thing I had to get used to was the really small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value considering NY prices”
Reviews.Author: dr_dohh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight, from October 7 to 8. I must say this is a good hotel considering that it's cheapest hotel I've researched around the area. As soon as I got off Penn station, we went to Empire state, and from then, walked 9 blocks north to get to this hotel. It was very close to the Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's Cathedral, and Times Square, so its a great tourist spot. I was also very pleased with the complimentary breakfast (not continental), since the more expensive hotels don't even have this particular service. Lastly I was impressed with the cleanliness and the amenities of the rooms. However there are some things that need improvement. First off, the hotel room was pretty small (got the standard), the second smallest hotel I've stayed in. I don't mind though, I've stayed in smaller hotels, but don't expect any room for any activities other than sleeping and reading the newspaper. I suspect it's because real estate is expensive in NY. Another thing was that their TV was not hi-def. It had HBO, sure, but it's very blurry, most likely due to cable issues. Their pay-per-view was also not working, so that was disappointing. Lastly, there is minimal soundproofing between walls. I can hear someone else's conversation right outside my door. Thankfully it wasn't too late at night, but it's a potentially bad situation. Overall though, I think the good things outweigh the bad. Great value considering its location and I really wanted to stay longer at this hotel. Probably not the best hotel in the area, but great extras and acceptable shortcomings make this a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: CelesteWuan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York City. This hotel had a great location, locals bar right across the street from the hotel. Lots of restaurants close to hotel for breakfast. Quick easy walk to Times Square, and "The Rock." The rooms are a little small, but it didn't matter since there was so much to do in the city. The walls are paper thin, while waiting for the elevator we could hear our friends talking in the room behind closed doors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Deborah0008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August/September '10 for 10 days with friends and really had a nice stay. I agree the rooms are very small, but everything is so clean and the location is amazing, the size of the rooms does not really matter. You are in NYC, it's not like you're spending the whole day in your room. The hotel is close to Times Square and also a 10 minutes walk to Grand Central Station where you can take the metro to explore NYC. The complimentary breakfast was a nice bonus. You had a choice between cooked things (eggs, bacon, toast, etc) and cold stuff (cereals, fruit, yoghurt, ...). There is not much space in the breakfastarea, but in the whole 10 days there was not a single day we really had to wait before we could sit down. You have to eat on carton plates and the knifes and forks were plastic, but that didn't really bother me. The complimentary wireless internet came in very handy and worked well. There is also a small business center with two computers where you can also print out documents for free. Overall I would certainly recommend this hotel. Great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “the smallest room that I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelx2
Reviews.Content: We flew to NYC for the long weekend to attend the US Open, we opted to stay in Manhattan and we booked this hotel using priority points. Check-in was 3pm. We arrived just after noon, early check-in was not available because there were no rooms available. Fair enough. We went back at 2:45pm, still no rooms available. OK fine, technically it was not 3pm. We shopped in the around and came back at 4pm, they had the nerve to say "let me check, I'm not sure if your room is available yet". The hotel is tiny and cramped. If you have a 26" rolling suitcase, then that is too much because you'll take up the entire hallway. The elevators took FOREVER! After riding the elevator a couple of times, I decided to take the stairs from the 10th floor down rather than waiting. My guess was that one of the elevators was not functioning? The room was very small, we had a king size bed. You have enough room to walk around the bed. That's it. I am happy to report on the overall cleanliness though. Although you do not hear any noise from the outside, the walls are thin and you can hear conversations in the adjacent rooms, and you can hear the ice machines and people opening and closing their doors. The hotel offered complimentary breakfast. The food is decent and they change their selection. Be prepared for the crowds, there isn't enough seating so people find any space to stand and eat. Aside from the great location, I'm doubtful that I would return to this particular hotel. It was my first time staying at a Holiday Inn Express so I don't really have a basis for comparison...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Ro_Hetho
Reviews.Content: Location was good. Other than that, it was absolutely awful. I arrived jet lagged to find out the clearly untrained people at reception had canceled my booking, even though AMEX travel had confirmed late arrival as part of the booking. It took the three staff at reception 1.5hrs to figure out how to reinstate my booking (while I sat in reception, tired after a long flight - it was 3.30am in the timezone I'd arrived from) because they wouldn't let me into the room until they had reinstated the booking. Into the room. Wet patches on the floor. I don't know why and don't want to. The room looked onto the air vent in middle of building (dark area of rubble) with a third of a curtain in the window. Room was located next to the lift and people were talking outside my door as they came and went all night. The wall that my bed headboard was up against must have been chipboard. The other side of it was where the hotel staff rammed trolleys all through the night. Every night. It felt like my headboard was violently knocked by this every few minutes. In the morning it took the hotel staff 40 minutes to locate an iron for me. (Which meant I was late for a meeting). I had some laundry and dry cleaning done, which looked ok. However, on the day of an extremely important meeting, I put on a pair of trousers (which had just been dry cleaned). I noticed the zip was a little stiff, but managed to do them up. During the meeting I went to the bathroom - and when I got there discovered the zip was completely stuck. I had back to back meetings scheduled, so I had to rush back to the hotel and convince a lady hotel staff member that, yes, I did really want to be cut out of the trousers NOW so I could get back to the office (in a skirt) ASAP. Other comments: - The electricity is only very low voltage. My laptop, phone etc took a long time to charge and my hairdryer only functioned at half strength. - The staff were friendly but did not seem to have the experience / knowledge / skills to solve any of the challenges that came up during my stay. When I checked out, the cost of the laundry was charged to my credit card but was not included on my receipt (which means I now can't claim it as a work expense). The Holiday Inn Express does not provide an email address and the phone has been ringing out when I tried to call, so I'm unsure whether there is now any way to request the receipt. If you are wondering why I stayed - I did try to move hotel when I arrived, saw the place and realized they would not allow me into the room before working out how to reinstate my booking. I have to stay at hotels that my company gets a special rate with and no other hotel on that list had a room available during peak season at such short notice. I will not be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unsleepable- unless you are a mouse.”
Reviews.Author: Wheretonext5
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny- picture two double beds in a closet. If your luggage was on the floor you could not walk by. We had two adults and one teenager. No one slept. We left to stay at another hotel for the second night. We were in NYC visiting colleges for our daughter and could not check out for the second night until 30 minutes past the deadline and the front desk would not be flexible enough to credit us for the second night. Location is the only thing this has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk from Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: goodrzy
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, rooms are tiny, but ours was fine for an overnight stay. Most important to us was the quick walk from Grand Central to the hotel. We arrived very early and were able to store our luggage until check in time. When we checked out we were able to store our luggage until we were ready to leave the city. Breakfast was fine. If you don't go for the complimentary breakfast scene, there are a couple of breakfast places within a few steps. There's a twenty four hour pharmacy nearby on Fifth Avenue. This came in handy for toothbrushes. Although the little card in the room said that common toiletries were available from the front desk, when I asked for a toothbrush the desk clerk said "we don't have any." At check in time the young woman on the desk was very helpful when I came back after checking out because I had left something in the room. There were lots of channels on the TV, including TCM, so if you need to rest before going out for the night you can watch a classic movie,

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel near Rockefellar Plaza”
Reviews.Author: no_worries182
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HI Express July 15-17, 2010. We were attending a TODAY show event on the Plaza and I wanted to book a hotel close to the show. We were within 2 blocks of it. The hotel itself is very clean-which is the most important aspect of any hotel for me. Our king bed room was small..it was tight for my husband and I to walk past each other between the foot of the bed and the t.v., however, it was sizable enough for our luggage and a desk and separate sitting chair. The bathroom was normal size. We were in our room so little that this didnt bother us one bit. The hotel is tall, and I believe there are only 6 rooms per floor. So as you can imagine, the rooms are narrow. The breakfast was good, typical for HI Express. However there is not nearly enough seating in the lobby/breakfast area (again-its a very tall narrow building), so both mornings we took our trays up to our room. The service was excellent for us. Our smoke detector beeped a few times on and off so we told this to the front desk and it was fixed almost immediately. We were very pleased with our stay and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: phil-the-badger
Reviews.Content: What else could you want from a hotel in New York ? - great location (a couple of minutes walk from grand Central, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre), clean and tidy, well maintained, air conditioned rooms, good value for money, complimentary breakfast (a rarity in New York). Ok the rooms aren't huge but we expected that from New York. Overall the service from reception employees was very good with a couple of minor exceptions (one gentleman wasn't the brightest and one was rude on an occassion).

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but very good location”
Reviews.Author: 5herry
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very very small but the hotel is in a great location - just off 5th avenue. The complimentary breakfast was great - very tasty...I crave the cinnamon buns! Having free tea / coffee in the lobby all day was also great when you return from a long day of sightseeing. They also have free internet but the computers & printers rarely work. It's easy to hail down a taxi and the metro isn't too far.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethDawn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Holiday Inn from June 19-23. We had a one bedroom suite on the 16th floor. The room was quite large by New York standards. The bedroom had a king-size bed with a flat screen tv, while the living room had a pull-out couch with another flat screen tv. There was also a small fidge and a microwave in the room, as well. Bathroom was small-ish, but worked just fine for us. The room was always very clean and well appointed with creams, soaps, shampoo, etc. Always plenty of fresh towels. We found the service was excellent at the hotel. From the front desk staff to the bell boys, everyone was always smiling and willing to help point us in the right direction. The free breakfast was nice too, as there was always eggs, sausage, toast, cereals, etc. The eating area was pretty small, so we just grabbed a tray and ate our breakfast in our room every morning... no big deal. The location can't be beat. You're a stones throw away from Times Sqaure (about 5 min walk), Fifth Ave shopping, Central Park (10 min), and all the major bus/ subway routes. There are lots of places to eat all around the hotel, so finding a meal was never an issue. We only had to take a cab twice for our entire stay. Let's be real: while in NYC, the only time you're really in the room is in the mornings and at night before bed. This hotel is a great base for daily adventures around the city. There aren't a lot of fancy frills, but it is more than adequate for a standard visit to NYC. If you're considering going to the Big Apple and need a clean, friendly place to stay at decent rates, I would definitely recommend checking out the HIE 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Very GOOD place.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsSometimes
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I decided on this hotel and dont regret it. Just like for many others the service was excellent, hallways, bathroom & room were always clean. Excellent A/C, coffee machine in the room, and flat screen TV. Everyone was always there to help. Like in any other hotel, breakfast was 6 to 10am and more than a continental breakfast (scramble eggs, cheese omeletts, beef patties, dif. cereals, and many more things to choose+coffee and hot chocolate 24/7). The breakfast area was a little small but only once did we have to wait for a table. The room was also a little small but we didnt care since we were there only to shower and sleep. Transportation was easy because we were close to everything. There were many places to eat around the hotel and we were a few blocks from Times Sq. and Rockefeller Center. If we ever decide to go back to NY we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot be the price, great location,super clean rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: katenj
Reviews.Content: I went to the Holiday Inn Express with friends on 6/20/2010. The room is small, but we only stayed one night. Super clean. I have stayed in more expensive places that were not this clean. Air conditioner worked great, it was very hot when we were there. Bathroom was good size, good shower. They have a continental breakfast that was quite good. Not your usual pastries and coffee. Scrambled eggs, biscuits, sausage and gravy. The front desk was very nice, and the rest of the staff was very nice. There is a parking garage on the next block. Ask at the front desk for the voucher, and you will only pay $35.00 for parking. That is great in NYC for 24hours. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: wellswells74
Reviews.Content: Very close midtown office district, Times Square, Bryant Park, central park is 3/4 miles away. short cab ride to Soho service: helpful with directions and checkin rooms: small, but clean. Fine for solo traveler, but if going with three person family it would be tight elevators: were quick Got a 5% cash rebate through this site http://www.mrrebates.com?refid=424037 though will take a few months to fully process

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: rnuge10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a quick getaway to see a show. Great location, clean, and nice staff. Room was small, but that's New York. Very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great basecamp for long jaunts outside; but don't get ill on check-out day”
Reviews.Author: FairTaxBill
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right-off Fifth av and excellent cab frequency. Free breakfast plus free internet: both Ethernet & WiFi with decent download speed. A very clean and spacious stone tiled and counter bathroom is wonderful. The flat screen TV didn't work; as I was their for one night, engineering coming by in the morning, didn't help me. Rooms are tight; in order to keep the rates low (make their rent through volume), which also allows for a designed hotel to provide for long jaunts outside with minimal time in the room for activities like sleeping, and hygiene. Friendly front desk staff is trained to always ask if you would like a wake-up call. Nice touch for a limited frills property. After observing the clerk scribe correctly both the time and room number, my call never happened. I did verify a working phone and the staff called me at 11a.m. to learn of my check-out plans. For the price you pay, you can't blame them, as they need to keep the property maintenance on schedule, or costs get too high. If you want to use a fitness center, as the desk for a discounted day pass to the nearby sports club--great facility. Now here's the egregious part. I became quite ill from food poisoning (outside of the hotel) the morning before I left--an hour after the missed wake-up call. I seriously could not leave the room and did not till 4p.m. Long story short, my conclusion is that they have a history of clientèle squatting rooms--claiming to be sick, so they can stay in the room past check-out. Sadly, that was not my case. Even the request for extra bathroom supplies didn't alarm them. So with a full 100% occupancy looming that evening, they took the heavy hand and sent security down to force me from my room and gave me five minutes to vacate the room or they would pack it for me. They also threatened to charge me for all the delays (earlier in the day); this seemed odd to me, but made sense afterwards (squatting deterrent). When I refused to leave in five minutes because I was dehydrated and couldn't pack all my items in that short of time, I was told that I would be arrested if I didn't leave. I am serious. I know my rights and refused, telling them I would leave at 4pm which I did. To their credit, Security stopped by at 4pm to check the room. They then realized that I was telling the truth and swiftly told the front desk to not charge me for the delays. But, no apology was offered from either the hotel, or the manager present during the conversation with security. (Two hours later I took a cab to ER--better now). I am truly sorry that people try to take advantage of their rate by lying about their health to extend the stay for free, but they also have to train their staff for exception management. Bottom line: if you don't have any problems, you will enjoy the place; don't expect to stay in the rooms much, and get out to enjoy the city; if you have a need for a late check-out, this is not the place. If you don't care about service, you will enjoy it. Other than breakfast and Internet service, they are quite a no-frills outfit--which they advertise. N.B. My room rating and service are based upon my experience and that certain items didn't work and for the thin wall that allowed me to hear my neighbor just twice overnight. Others with fully operational rooms, will probably give higher rates. My friends were disgusted with how I was treated while ill, so I would probably not recommend the property to them.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: kevin186470
Reviews.Content: .i had read some of the reviews before we went over & we were greatly surprised how good everything was from the bedroom to the friendly staff.We will not thing twice of booking this hotel again when we return.Kevin De Largy Bangor N.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location, very clean, very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: aspiring_traveller5
